PROBLEM.SHORT: ERROR (20 points): The checker returned the IP address for . This is syntactically bad and unusable.

ERROR (20 points): The domain name of contains zero length labels. A domain name is formed by labels separated by dots. The minimum length of such a label is 1 octet, as specified in RFC 2181, section 11.

ERROR (20 points): The label in the domain name of is too long. It is octets, the maximum is 63 octets. A domain name is formed by labels separated by dots. The maximum length of such a label is 63 octets, specified in RFC 2181, section 11.
ERROR (20 points): The domain name of is too long. It is octets compared to the maximum of octets permitted by RFC 2181, section 11.
ERROR (20 points): The nameserver name appears more than once in the submitted domain object.

ERROR (20 points): The expire value in the SOA record returned by this nameserver is less than the refresh value in the same record.
WARNING (7 points): The expire value in the SOA record returned by this nameserver is less than the sum of the refresh () and retry () values in the same record.
INFO: The expire value () in the SOA record returned by this nameserver is not within the suggested range. RFC 1912 recommends between two and four weeks for this value.
ERROR (20 points): The hostname of has a numeric Top Level Domain. This is probably because you entered the IP address instead of the hostname.

ERROR (20 points): The label in the hostname of contains illegal characters. A hostname label must consist of the characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9 or '-'. Please see RFC 1912, section 2.1, for more information on hostname restrictions.
ERROR (20 points): The label in the hostname of does not start and end with a letter or digit. Please see RFC 1912, section 2.1, for more information on hostname restrictions.
ERROR (20 points): The hostname of only has one label. A domain name is formed by labels separated by dots.
